meanings.definition: A unit of mass equal to one trillionth of a gram.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use picograms to measure tiny particles in the air.
meanings.sent2: The lab equipment can detect picograms of a substance in a sample.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled a picogram of sugar in my coffee!
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe, a picogram of stardust may hold countless secrets.
meanings.sent5: The scale was so precise, it could weigh a single picogram.

meanings.definition: A very small amount of something.
meanings.sent1: She only needed a picogram of paint to touch up the wall.
meanings.sent2: A picogram of patience can go a long way in difficult situations.
meanings.sent3: I have a picogram of interest in learning how to knit.
meanings.sent4: His words carried a picogram of wisdom beyond his years.
meanings.sent5: The chef added a picogram of spice to the dish for extra flavor.
